discourse_list.title: [\xf0\x9f\x93\x84] Collateral Onboarding Call #15: Paperchain - Wednesday, November 11 18:00 UTC

content.content: Paperchain Agenda_2960×540 76.4 KB Please check your local time as DST happens around this time of the year. Please check your local time as DST happens around this time of the year. Please check your local time as DST happens around this time of the year. Time in your local-timezone format: 2020-11-11T18:00:00Z Dial In Details Zoom Call Passcode: RWA-WG Intro An open discussion where we discuss projects and potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join. If you’d like to present, check out this thread Agenda Intro by  @juanjuan Paperchain [PC-DROP] MIP6 Application: Paperchain DROP: Tokenized Music Streaming Invoices Budd White from Paperchain will be joining to explain what they do and how this could work with Maker.  Paperchain Q&A  PC-DROP, its uses, and potential as a collateral type. Q&A  See you there! attn: @paperchain ; @amyjung; @blimpa ; @_LS ; @spin ; @SebVentures ; @mrabino1

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #15  November 11th, 2020 Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  02:49: Paperchain Drop [PC-DROP] with Budd White  Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UnwkQJPSUrc Introduction Juan Guillén Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello, everyone. Welcome to another collateral onboarding call. We’re joined by a bunch of people interested in Maker in general and real-world assets in particular. We are with Budd White, who’s going to give us more of an insight and overview about the project. But before that, I want to give the floor to Sébastien Derivaux, who’s going to comment on the progress of the Real-World Assets Working Group. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   Collateral Paperchain [PC-DROP]  [PC-DROP] MIP6 Application: Paperchain DROP: Tokenized Music Streaming Invoices  Budd White Presentation 02:49 1920×1080 92 KB 1920×1080 204 KB 1920×1080 116 KB 1920×1080 133 KB 1920×1080 112 KB 1920×1080 168 KB 17:46 - Can you do this as well with affiliate marketing platforms? 1920×1080 136 KB 22:41 - Do you pool the loans of the different borrowers together or do you have them completely separated? How do you manage the risk on that side? 1920×1080 193 KB 1920×1080 136 KB 44:02 - The revolving means that, as the pool is getting paid, you will issue more debt based on that same pool. Is that right? 1920×1080 102 KB Discussion  29:27 - Wouldn’t this be easier if you just become an invoice refactoring service for Spotify, so you just get money from the discount rate? 31:25 - How often have you seen or would expect to see the data be different, have the data be subsequently modified? Somebody listened to a song 50,000 times, but it was actually 5,000 times — or the reverse. 32:23 - What is the gross dollar amount impact that you expect, even on a percentage basis? Out of the total amount of the net portfolio, 2% sometimes is dodgy. 35:15 - As a company, are you diversifying, are you going to target independent artists and quite possibly help the movement of decentralizing some of these platforms, some of these venues? Also, what has happened since that article that was published by Centrifuge and Maker on October 29th [2019]? What has happened in the last 12 months? 46:15 - Let’s hypotetically say that Maker was able to give you a 10 million Dai facility at whatever risk parameters you want to do. What could you deploy tomorrow? 47:34 - If you had to give a timeline estimate to where you could routinely revolve eight figures, what would you say? 49:40 - Can you go over and try to explain to us how exactly the bridge works between Centrifuge and getting to Dai, to Ethereum? 53:52 - What’s the worst thing that could potentially happen to a pool? Are there any mitigation plans for that?  Closing Comment Juan Guillén Outro 57:28  Budd, thanks for coming. It was great having you. I’m looking forward to see how these things evolve. Where can people find you and Paperchain?   Credits   @blimpa produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
Thanks all for joining. Recording + notes coming soon. By the way, here’s the article referenced during the call.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: [\xf0\x9f\x93\x84] Collateral Onboarding Call #17: Blocksquare.io - Wednesday, November 25 18:00 UTC

content.content: collateral171280×720 58.2 KB  Time in your local-timezone format: 2020-11-25T18:00:00Z  Dial In Details Zoom Call Passcode: RWA-WG  Intro An open discussion where we discuss projects and potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join. If you’d like to present, check out this thread  Agenda  Intro by  @juanjuan  blocksquare Presentation (https://blocksquare.io/) by @Denis   Real estate tokenization protocol: A Pre-MIP Discussion This forum post is quite meaty, if you’re interested in the topic.  See you there! attn: @SebVentures  ; @amyjung; @blimpa ; @_LS ; @spin ; @Primoz  ; @mrabino1

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #17  November 25th, 2020 Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  00:53: Blocksquare with Denis Petrovcic et al  23:43: Q&A and Discussion about Collateral Blocksquare  Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1SnN7WB3ffw Introduction Juan Guillén Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome to another Collateral Onboarding Call. Today we are here joined by Denis, Victor and Jure from Blocksquare. They’re going to explain their project and hopefully we can have an open conversation and ask questions, interrupt a lot and they can tell us more about the project. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   Collateral Blocksquare  Real estate tokenization protocol: A Pre-MIP Discussion   Denis Petrovcic et al Presentation 00:53 The tokenization infrastructure...1920×1080 196 KB 100s of real estate...1920×1080 135 KB 2019 Global Commercial...1920×1080 137 KB Tokenization will change...1920×1080 295 KB Diversification...1920×1080 146 KB If only 0.1%...1920×1080 133 KB Tokenization of real estate is currently...1920×1080 160 KB Our solution?1920×1080 191 KB Tokenization protocol1920×1080 147 KB A digital slice...1920×1080 205 KB Revenue-based asset...1920×1080 151 KB Gross rental income1920×1080 209 KB Smart contract & legal document1920×1080 202 KB Etherscan1920×1080 180 KB Launch your investment portal...1920×1080 168 KB Safely connect investors...1920×1080 159 KB Add tradability...1920×1080 176 KB Let investors customize...1920×1080 157 KB Analytic tools...1920×1080 145 KB Financing for issuers...1920×1080 132 KB Collateral risk scoring...1920×1080 145 KB Competitive accomplishments...1920×1080 203 KB Builtworld...1920×1080 204 KB Team...1920×1080 209 KB Thank you1920×1080 146 KB Discussion  23:43 - What are the various transfer restrictions applied to the token? 25:33 - In some of the other RWA applications we’ve had the liquidations are handled off-chain. How would you liquidate these assets on-chain given the transfer restrictions and demonstrate that there will actually be liquidity in the event that the asset is liquidated? 30:36 - When you were mentioning that the company signs a corporate resolution, in effect you’re basically tokenizing a revenue participation agreement, which I think is quite novel. The question I have, though, is: how is that actually implemented in the context of – whoever is paying that revenue, where is the crossover point where you’re going from fiat into a token? How is that managed? 33:01 - We would prefer to have on-chain liquidations in Maker, but other implementations are actually using option liquidations as well because we just can’t find a way to make them on-chain because of all these constraints that you mentioned. With the property token that you issue, I’m not really sure if even option liquidations are truly possible. 38:06 - Even if things go right, when someone —Maker or someone else— gets these tokens, do you know what future returns to expect or it’s more like I’m buying Tesla and I hope it goes up compared to…? 41:00 - Right now, when we issue a loan in Dai, we put a fee which is equivalent to the interest rate, but I’m guessing that in this case that would not be the case, that you would be sharing any potential revenues but they would not be determined by what we call the stability fee 43:45 - With regards to restrictive tokens, is it possible to do an ERC1404? I would imagine yes, so: assuming I’m a commercial property owner, I have a mixed-use property and I want to raise some money to fix the building, I guess I could go generate some register securities as tokens, use your platform to get these tokens and then give them out to the people who want to invest. And then I could put some restrictions on it with something like an ERC 1404  Closing Comment Juan Guillén Outro 47:19   Seb wants to give us an update on the RWA working group. Thank you again, Denis, Viktor and Jure from Blocksquare for coming to the call. Let’s keep the conversation going on the forum.  Credits   @blimpa produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
